name: delzhand
text: That is a given.

name: sweetlips
text: And so begins the greatest moment in Achewood's great history.

name: ih8jonmayr
text: Whenever I read through all of Achewood from the start, this strip brings me the greatest joy.

name: onegoodmonkey
text: This is completely a thing

name: omega
text:
This strip is ruined for me because I know the artwork is lazily ripped from a previous strip. What!

(but still, I find it to be quite good despite my misgivings)

name: deimosrising
text: Somewhere on the internet, this strip and the film Cars combine, and knowing this, I weep.

name: centipede_damascus
text: A comment left by centipede_damascus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, ShemmJacc, MrEctomy, mattfish)

name: killerlimpet
text: Dr. Manflesh? This is your assignment, should you choose to accept it.

name: professorhazard
text: Sad epilogue to Cars : Lightning McQueen slashes his own tires

name: dejavroom
text: It's an exciting time.

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text: "oat tote" makes me giggle far too much.

name: stuart
text: Gotta love someone who can use "oat tote" and "phallus" in the same breath.

name: jackparsons
text: Nope, still not gettin' it. What does 'oat tote' mean? A scotum covered with dried grass? How are the testes 'oats'? Is this some weird cross-lingual pun like in Finnegan's Wake?

name: goosey
text: Oats are seeds. What's not to get?

name: bourbonsamurai
text: 'Xactly. Like "sowing your wild oats." I love the transition into business Ray in this one.

name: charchar
text: I though it was like those feed bags you strap over a horse's nose.  God only knows why this made sense to me.

name: boredom_man
text: SNIFF SNAFF SNOOF

name: lrosetw8
text: A comment left by lrosetw8 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Ebessan, mattfish, Myre)

name: tekende
text: HE'S TALKING 'BOUT THE NUTSACK

name: fineoakstructure
text: so awesome

name: lexsenthur
text:
Oat

Tote

name: 1000hz
text: And so begins perhaps the greatest arc in Achewood history.

name: natashamarie
text: best. ever.

name: dasilodavi
text: Yes, I can now say that the beginning of my favorite arc, The Great Outdoor Fight, has begun.

name: chrissketch
text: I think I'd read Achewood occasionally in the past, but once the GOF arc was underway I became a permanently hooked reader.

name: dumase
text: C'mon, you guys say that about every arc.

name: 1000hz
text: But this is the only arc that is the Great Outdoor Fight.

name: buttermoths
text: Oh yes. Just clicking 'random comic' here, but now I'm cracking open a crispy Stella and clicking 'next comic'. Awww yeeeah

name: lost_buoy
text: I am stalking you with a bottle of Paringas Cab Sauv in hand.

name: tellumo
text:
I have an open bottle of 100 proof Smirnoff, and therefore think I beat both of you.

(ok, not really)

(the bottle is closed, but it'll be open in about five seconds)

name: boredom_man
text: I only buy the 100-proof when I aim to soak wormwood in it.

name: saint
text:
This is exactly what I did.
Chubbied for like-mindedness on this momentous arc.

name: skyisfalling
text: I came in here (The Mountain and the Motorcycle). Its one hell of a first time strip, so I went to the start and have been SLOWLY working may way here. It would have taken less time, but you people are far too entertaining to skip over the comments. I've been reading so much about the GOF and how its the best thing on the internet. I'm a little hesitant to go forward, especially without making it a bit of an Event first. Looks like Ill have to take an afternoon off next weekend, probably involving fine spirits and perhaps a cigar.

name: lrosetw8
text: This was the first Achewood I ever read. I did not get it at ALL. But then the GOF storyarc drew me in, and I was gone....

name: deusoma
text: Note that in the alt text a Honda Civic is the receiver.

name: presterjohn
text: It is a lame car. Sensible, but lame.

name: durrr
text: A comment left by durrr was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, Deusoma, mattylite)

name: presterjohn
text: c.f. Achewood on October 28, 2005 and chill the hell out.

name: beansdooma
text: Ray takes off the suit to discuss buisness.

name: mashuren
text:
Time for me to go back and read the best story arc of all time again.

Hard to believe it was only two short years ago.

name: baryonyx
text: Ray certainly derives some odd givens from the reality he perceives.

name: kamet
text: I drive a Civic.. and it's so true.  The Pilot is a menace.

name: direhaggis
text: I call bullshit. Todd is just going to get hookers and blow. Maybe some nachos.

name: doomchild
text:
He did it before, after all. I've often wondered if he'd have wound up back in the Dementia Arms had Ray's mother not gotten her burn on.

DC

name: excusemesenator
text: Looking at this, I was underwhelmed. Then, when it moved on to CHatSacks, I became amused again. Then it turned into the GOF. Man, who could possibly have seen that being where this strip would lead to? I don't even think Onstad knew where this was going to end up, and that's awesome.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
I think I need to step away from the computer for a second. I've got an appointment later today and this is the arc that you have to commit to reading in one sitting every time you read it.

I'll be back with a bong and some green, fellows.

name: rasalghul
text: I am on my way to Las Vegas for vacation.  I am actually looking forward to coming back and reading this arc in one sitting.  Can't wait.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Oh, man, I just hit Random and got here.  Sign from God.
